thread.title: Man United star discusses time frame on injury he suffered in Hull draw
thread.title_full: Man United star discusses time frame on injury he suffered in Hull draw

title: Man United star discusses time frame on injury he suffered in Hull draw
text:
Man United star discusses time frame on injury he suffered in Hull draw MANCHESTER UNITED star Phil Jones dismissed the seriousness of his injury last night. By Dan Gibbs PUBLISHED: PUBLISHED: 04:00, Thu, Feb 2, 2017 
The defender had to be taken off on 55 minutes during Manchester United's 0-0 draw with Hull at Old Trafford. 
Jones left the field holding his right boot in his hand as he limped down the tunnel with fans fearing it could be a lengthy spell on the sidelines. 
But the 24-year-old says he should be fine in a few days and is expecting to be in contention for United's trip to Leicester on Sunday (4pm). 
"My foot's bruised but I'll be fine," he told MUTV after the match. GETTY Phil Jones insists his injury isn't serious Man United fans reacts as Phil Jones limps off against Hull Wed, February 1, 2017 Express Sport brings you all the best tweets as Phil Jones limps off during Manchester United's clash with Hull Man Utd via Getty Images 1 of 10 Man United's Phil Jones limped off against Hull and this is how fans reacted GETTY Phil Jones limped off on 55 minutes in United's 0-0 draw with Hull My foot's bruised but I'll be fine Phil Jones 
"It's nothing sinister, nothing serious, so hopefully in a few days I'll be fine." 
United failed to make the breakthrough against a resilient Hull defence to close the gap on their rivals at the top. 
Zlatan Ibrahimovic , Paul Pogba and Juan Mata all had decent chances but goalkeeper Eldin Jakupovic was equal to them. 
And Jones admits the Switzerland international's heroics were frustrating for his team. 
He added: "I think if we had scored in the first 20 minutes, then you couldn't have seen much of a way back for Hull with us 1-0 up, creating chance after chance. But we just couldn't get that goal. Manchester United player ratings: Who impressed against Hull? Wed, February 1, 2017
